title: Simple circuits - battery with SA SB RX and RY

content.question:
The figure shows a circuit containing two resistors <math alttext="R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="R sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, two switches <math alttext="S sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="S sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, and a battery. The two switches are in the following positions at the following times.

Time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>: both switches are open.

Time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>: <math alttext="S sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> is closed and <math alttext="S sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> is open.

Time <math alttext="t sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>: both switches are closed.
Which of the following correctly relates the potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> across resistor <math alttext="R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> at the three times?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta V sub X 2, end sub, equals delta V sub X 3, end sub, which is greater than delta V sub X 1, end sub, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 2</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 3</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 1</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub X 2, end sub, equals delta V sub X 3, end sub, which is greater than delta V sub X 1, end sub, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 2</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 3</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 1</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub X 3, end sub, is greater than delta V sub X 2, end sub, which is greater than delta V sub X 1, end sub, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 3</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 2</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 1</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub X 3, end sub, is greater than delta V sub X 2, end sub, which is greater than delta V sub X 1, end sub, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 3</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 2</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 1</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta V sub X 2, end sub, equals delta V sub X 3, end sub, which is greater than delta V sub X 1, end sub, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 2</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 3</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X 1</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
